sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of equations for the unknown variables x, y, and z: 

3x + 2y + 5zi = 7 + 2i 

2x - 4y + z = -1 + 6i 

x + 3y - 2zi = 4 - 9i 

Where i is the imaginary unit.
message_2:
To solve this system of equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. We will use the elimination method.

First, let's rewrite the given system of equations:

(1) 3x + 2y + 5zi = 7 + 2i
(2) 2x - 4y + z = -1 + 6i
(3) x + 3y - 2zi = 4 - 9i

We will eliminate x from equations (2) and (3). To do this, we will multiply equation (3) by 2:

(3') 2(x + 3y - 2zi) = 2(4 - 9i)
(3') 2x + 6y - 4zi = 8 - 18i

Now, subtract equation (2) from (3'):

(4) 10y - 3zi = 9 - 24i

Next, we will eliminate x from equations (1) and (3). To do this, we will multiply equation (3) by 3:

(3'') 3(x + 3y - 2zi) = 3(4 - 9i)
(3'') 3x + 9y - 6zi = 12 - 27i

Now, subtract equation (1) from (3''):

(5) 7y - zi = 5 - 25i

Now we have two equations with two unknowns, y and z:

(4) 10y - 3zi = 9 - 24i
(5) 7y - zi = 5 - 25i

We will eliminate y from equations (4) and (5). To do this, we will multiply equation (5) by 10/7:

(5') 10y - (10/7)zi = (50/7) - (250/7)i

Now, subtract equation (4) from (5'):

(6) (7/3)zi = (10/7) - (10/7)i

Now, divide both sides of equation (6) by (7/3):

z = (10/7)(3/7) - (10/7)i(3/7)
z = (30/49) - (30/49)i

Now that we have z, we can find y using equation (5):

7y - (1)(30/49 - 30/49i) = 5 - 25i
7y = 5 - 25i + 30/49 - 30/49i
7y = (245/49) - (1190/49)i
y = (35/7) - (170/7)i

Now that we have y and z, we can find x using equation (3):

x + 3(35/7 - 170/7i) - 2(30/49 - 30/49i) = 4 - 9i
x = 4 - 9i - 3(35/7) + 3(170/7)i + 60/49 - 60/49i
x = (28/7) + (510/7)i

So the solution to the system of equations is:

x = (28/7) + (510/7)i
y = (35/7) - (170/7)i
z = (30/49) - (30/49)i
